file_content.text: Healing the minds of the Killik slaves will take time, and possibly Jedi.
Surprising turn of events here. It's good to make your acquaintance.
Our mutual friend Elz says you found and freed the prisoners who have been coming in today.
Of course, he smeared them in thranta dung and dragged them through a river to throw Killiks off the scent, but that's Elz for you.
Not good. The Killiks made them ingest a mind-affecting ooze of some kind. It will take time to wean them off it.
But their families wanted you to have a little something. I said I'd pass it on to you--or you'd have been mobbed by grateful people.
You did all right out there.
How valuable were these lives to the Republic?
Do I get paid for this?
That remains to be seen--many of them are unstable. But House Organa doesn't label one life valuable and another cheap.
As such, they did not want to see you unrewarded. You have served their old vassal house, and Organa by extension. Congratulations.
Just how long has he been alone in those mountains?
He did seem a bit odd.
A year or more. Long enough to choose a pet name for each Killik he tracked.
But I wouldn't mock his habits. He got every captive through the Killik lines alive.
Without the two of you, these people would still be digging ditches and eating that foul Killik ooze. I must pass on their gratitude.
I handle prisoner exchanges. You are not one of them.
